extendedInfo.description: Winner of the 2011 White House and HHS âApps Against Abuseâ Technology ChallengeWinner Avon Foundation for Women/Institute of Medicine "Ending Violence @Home"By: Co-created by YTH (formerly ISIS) www.yth.org and Tech for Good, Inc.Featured in Chronicle of Philanthropy, Christian Science Monitor, Al-Jazeera, and Cosmopolitanâ¢ Now available in Hindi! Hotlines customized for New Delhiâ¢ à¤à¤¬ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤®à¥à¤, à¤¨à¤ à¤¦à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤²à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¸ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥Users Please Note! You do not need 6 people to use this app successfully. You can fill in as few as you want, and double up to complete the number 6. Thank you for your notes and feedback.Vice President Joe Biden says, âThanks to the creativity and vision of these developers, young people now have a new line of defense against violence in their lives.âWith Circle of 6 you have a new way to connect with your most trusted friends- to stay close, stay safe and prevent violence before it happens! It's the mobile way to look out for your friends - on campus or when you're out for the night.Circle of 6 lets you choose six trusted friends to add to your circle. If you get into an uncomfortable or risky situation, use Circle of 6 to automatically send your circle a pre-programmed SMS alert message, with your exact location. Itâs quick. Itâs discreet. Two taps on your iPhone is all it takes.Hereâs how it works:â¢ You're out late and you lose track of your friends. Use Circle of 6 to send your circle a âcome and get meâ message- with a map using GPS to show your precise location.â¢ You're on a date that starts to get uncomfortable. You need a polite way to excuse yourself. Use Circle of 6 to alert your circle to call you and interrupt the situation.â¢ You're seeing someone new, but you have some doubts about how things are going. Use Circle of 6 to access a wealth of online information about healthy relationships.â¢ In critical situations, use Circle of 6 to call two pre-programmed national hotlines or a local emergency number of your choice.About us:Circle of 6 is a project of YTH (formerly ISIS) and Tech for Good, Inc. YTH stands for youth + tech + health. At YTH, we work to advance youth and young adult health and wellness through technology. Founded in 2001 as ISIS, we have been the partner of choice for institutions and advocates looking for what works in the field of sexual and reproductive health, healthy relationships and technology for more than 12 years.  www.yth.orgTech for Good, Inc. is a start-up non-profit dedicated to violence prevention in vulnerable populations through the use of mobile technology and harm-reduction education principles. We are a lean, global team bringing our experience with storytelling, code and design to develop engaging tools and campaigns to support a culture of connectivity and accountability.(c) Tech for Good, Inc. and YTH www.yth.org

reviews.title: Don\'t need 6 people! There\'s a work around!
reviews.comment: Actually, you don\'t need 6 people to use this app. You can fill in as few as you want, and double up to complete the number 6.  Discovering and using this app has been such a great safety net, especially living in NYC. I have found it extremely useful in getting out of  uncomfortable social situations with drunken men. Also recently, I was followed by a creepy man from the subway, but thanks to circle of six, my neighborhood friend was waiting for me in front of my apartment by the time I arrived.
reviews.author: Hye Yun Park

reviews.comment: Very happy that it does not ask for intrusive permissions!
reviews.author: Skater d Rome

reviews.title: Looks nice
reviews.comment: Wish they had it for windows phones, then I could recommend it to some of my friends.
reviews.author: ezekiel juel

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: So nice
reviews.author: Rajesh K Garg

reviews.comment: Good app
reviews.author: sohel delani

reviews.title: Less Than 6 Please
reviews.comment: This is an awesome idea! Kudos to who ever created it.  But, I do not have 6 people in my life I trust for something like this. mod the app to accept 6 or less and I\'ll give it more than 3 stars.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Could Be Better
reviews.comment: I love the concept of this app and I\'ve been waiting for it\'s Android release, but I\'m a little dissapointed. As others have said, it would be much better if you had the option to use less than 6 people or maybe even have the option to choose one of the 6 instead of sending a message out to everyone. Also, I think you should have the option to edit the text message that the app sends out. As for things that should be fixed or looked into, when I go to the settings menu within the app, nothing happens. I would also like to see this app be able to be moved to the SD card.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I do not have six people for this
reviews.comment: I have three; four at absolute tops. And I\'m sure I\'m not the only one. I think this app would be great to have, and I know it\'ll save people from disastrous outcomes, but making it unusable if you don\'t fill in all six contacts is very effective at defeating the purpose of the whole thing.  Please remove the mandatory \"filling all six slots\" requirement; it\'ll be far more helpful for people who aren\'t lucky enough to have that many trusted people.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: circle of less dan 6 preferable....
reviews.comment: its relly grt....bt one genrally dnt hv dese much pipl in their lyf to col fo in emergncy....
reviews.author: shehnaz nisar

reviews.title: Great start, needs some improvements
reviews.comment: As another reviewer stated, this app needs an option of being able to add less than six contacts. Another option i think would improve the app is a widget, status bar, or lock screen option with the message commands provided in the app easily available via icon.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Would like support for other countries
reviews.comment: I live in Australia and really like this idea, but I want to be able to change the emergency numbers to those of my country. Support for being able to text less than 6 people would be helpful too.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Its nice.
reviews.comment: Can be much better, but its very nice.
reviews.author: Karan Anand

reviews.title: Issues with the 6
reviews.comment: I\'m getting very irritated with this app not allowing me to add the people I want to. Hopefully the reinstall will fix it, but if not, I\'m permanently uninstalling.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Limited contact availability?
reviews.comment: The app is not reading all of my contacts, even after externally syncing all contacts.  A way to manually add a contact/number to the circle would bypass that trouble.  Efficacy of app would increase tenfold if we were able to include the people we ought.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t function properly
reviews.comment: Tested this several times from several locations and it never gets my location even close to accurate.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: You don\'t need 6 people
reviews.comment: For everyone who does not have 6 people to add to their circle, it is possible to add people twice. I only have 4 people in my circle, but the app works because I repeated two contacts.
reviews.author: Rachel Leffel

reviews.title: Less than 6 fix
reviews.comment: Just add some contacts twice to fill the six slots. Duh.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Inoperable with less than six
reviews.comment: If you have fewer than six people in your circle, you cant tell your circle if there\'s a problem. It\'s possible people won\'t have six people they trust.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Must have
reviews.author: Jocelyn Ihrig

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: This is seriously great! Especially for college girls. Love it. I  will definitely encourage all of my friends  to get it too.
reviews.author: A Google User
